patterns: What kind of error can you solve
responses: Errors that occur at runtime (after passing the syntax test) are called exceptions or logical errors.

patterns: Why python logical errors can happen
responses: Errors that occur at runtime (after passing the syntax test) are called exceptions or logical errors.

patterns: How can i solve Assertion Error
responses: AssertionError is one of the logical error and its raise when an (assert statement fails).

patterns: How can i solve Attribute Error in python
responses: AttributeError is one of the logical error in python and its raise when (attribute assignment or reference fails).

patterns: How can i solve Floating Point Error
responses: FloatingPointError is one of the logical error in python and its raise when (a floating point operation fails).

patterns: How can i solve GeneratorExit Error
responses: GeneratorExit is one of the logical error in python and its raise when (a generator's close() method is called).

patterns: How can i solve Import Error
responses: ImportError is one of the common logical error in python and its raise when (imported module is not found or the import version is not incorrect).

patterns: How can i solve Index out of range Error
responses: IndexError is one of the common logical error in python and its raise when (the index of a sequence is out of range). Check your looping statement.

patterns: How can i solve Key Error
responses:
KeyError is one of the logical error in python and its found in python dictionary. 
 Its raise when (a key is not found in a dictionary). Check your Dictionary Keys and values.

patterns: How can i solve KeyboardInterrupt Error
responses: KeyboardInterrupt is one of the built-in exception in python and its raise when the user hits the interrupt key (Ctrl+C or Delete).

patterns: How can i solve Memory Error
responses: MemoryError is one of the built-in exception in python and its raise when (an operation runs out of memory).

patterns: How can i solve Name Error
responses: NameError can be raise when (a variable is not found in local or global scope). Please check your variable.

patterns: How can i solve NotImplemented Error
responses:
NotImplementedError is one of the built-in exception in python. It can happen by the abstract methods.
 The method in an abstract class that should be implemented in child class.

patterns: How can i solve OS Error
responses: OSError is one of the built-in exception in python. It can happen when system operation causes system related error.

patterns: How can i solve Overflow Error
responses: OSError is one of the built-in exception in python. You will get that error once your numbers are greater than (sys.maxsize) or when the result of an arithmetic operation is too large to be represented.

patterns: How can i solve Reference Error
responses: ReferenceError is one of the built-in exception in python. It can get when you use a weak reference proxy to access a garbage collected referent.

StopIteration can happen by 'next() function to indicate that there is no further item to be returned by iterator'.
 It's not an error, just an exception signalling the end of the iteration if you call .next() on it manually. The pythonic way to use it is to use it as a normal iterator (for example, looping over it) and not call .next() on it.

patterns: How can i solve Syntax Error
responses: SyntaxError is one of the logical error in python. It can be raise by parser when syntax error is encountered. You should check spelling on your code.

patterns: How can i solve Indentation Error
responses: IndentationError is one of the logical error in python. It can be raise when there is incorrect indentation in you line of code.

patterns: How can i solve Tab Error
responses: TabError is one of the logical error in python. It can be raise when indentation consists of inconsistent tabs and spaces. You Should check white space and tag etc...

patterns: How can i solve System Error
responses: SystemError is one of the logical error in python. It can be raise when interpreter detects internal error. SystemErrors probably indicate a bug in the interpreter and should be reported to the maintainer

patterns: How can i solve SystemExit Error
responses: SystemExit is one of the logical error in python. It can be raise by sys.exit() function. This allows cleanup code in try:finally blocks to run and special environments (like debuggers and test frameworks) to catch the exception and avoid exiting
TypeError raise when concatenate the wrong type of objects, or calling a function with the wrong type of object

patterns: How can i solve UnboundLocal Error
responses: UnboundLocalError raise when a reference is made to a local variable in a function or method, but no value has been bound to that variable

patterns: How can i solve UnboundLocal Error
responses: UnboundLocalError raise when a reference is made to a local variable in a function or method, but no value has been bound to that variable

patterns: How can i solve Unicode Error
responses: UnicodeError is subclass of ValueError, its raise when a function receives a value that has the right type but an invalid value

patterns: How can i solve Value Error
responses: ValueError is raise when a function receives a value that has the right type but an invalid value

patterns: How can i solve ZeroDivision Error
responses: ZeroDivisionError is one of the logical Error in python, and its raise when try to divide a number by zero. Eg: print(230/0)
